meanings.definition: A government building where duties are collected on imported goods.
meanings.sent1: The customshouses in the city are responsible for collecting taxes on items brought from other countries.
meanings.sent2: I had to visit the customshouses at the port to pay the required fees for my new shipment.
meanings.sent3: The customshouses were so busy that they had to hire extra staff to handle all the paperwork.
meanings.sent4: The customshouses stood like guardians at the entrance of the harbor, watching over the flow of goods.
meanings.sent5: The customshouses, with their tall columns and grand architecture, symbolized the authority of the government in trade matters.

meanings.definition: The officials working at a customshouse.
meanings.sent1: The customshouses were bustling with activity as the officials processed each shipment.
meanings.sent2: The customshouses' staff were known for their efficiency and attention to detail.
meanings.sent3: The customshouses' employees joked that they should start a reality show about their daily work.
meanings.sent4: The customshouses' workers were like puzzle solvers, figuring out the best way to clear each item.
meanings.sent5: The customshouses' team worked together like a well-oiled machine, ensuring smooth operations.

meanings.definition: The process of inspecting and clearing goods at a customshouse.
meanings.sent1: The customshouses' inspection process was thorough to prevent any illegal items from entering the country.
meanings.sent2: I watched as my package went through the customshouses' clearance procedures.
meanings.sent3: The customshouses' clearance process felt like a never-ending maze of paperwork and checks.
meanings.sent4: Navigating through the customshouses' clearance system was like a challenging game of strategy.
meanings.sent5: The customshouses' clearance operation ran like a well-choreographed dance, ensuring everything was in order.
